hints.content:
The first set of blocks shows $\purpleD1$ hundred, $\purpleD4$ tens, and $\purpleD8$ ones so, our first addend is $\purpleD{148}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f615765bf8f5e930ac3179e62cd75730d1377a03)

The second set of blocks shows $\maroonD7$ hundreds, $\maroonD4$ tens, and $\maroonD6$ ones so, our second addend is $\maroonD{746}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/313f0b59a28477414ec1ee766411309c040b8503)

We can put our two numbers together on the place value chart.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e9fedb66271b9dd2a64cf71a8004abba2907897c)

There are $8\text{ hundreds}, 8\text{ tens}$ and $14\text{ ones}$.

Now we can take our $14\text{ ones}$ and make $1\text{ ten}$ and $4\text{ ones}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/05f8eab1c40ef058f4d0f1d281856e907979153a)

Together, there are $\blueE8$ hundreds, $\blueE9$ tens, and $\blueE4$ ones.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/313267c1fcba62caa743316985eec471dd9141a0)

$800 +90 + 4 =\blueE{894}$

This equation represents the place value blocks:

$\purpleE{148} + \maroonD{746} = \blueE{894}$

question.content:

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/122dbc9466cf3e61ff990a511298e7f8410f3891)
